alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:41PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central New Castle, northern Kent, west central Cumberland and southwestern Salem Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dover Speedway, or over Dover, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dover, Smyrna, Camden, Clayton, Cheswold, Rising Sun-Lebanon, Woodland Beach, Hancocks Bridge, Hazlettville, Newport Meadows, Port Penn, Dover Base Housing, Dover Speedway, Saint Georges, Green Spring, Rising Sun, Hope Creek, Wyoming, Odessa and Kenton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and northern Delaware. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern New Jersey.
